title: Variables
text: Represent the number of each type of ticket using variables.The ice rink sold 95 tickets for the afternoon skating session, so you can represent general admissions tickets(g) as 95-c, and you can represent child tickets simply as c.

title: Multiplication
text: Multiply the number of each ticket type(in variable form) by its respective value.

title: Conversion
text: Now, translate the expressions that were multiplied by their monetary values into a single equation. This will be $$\operatorname{10}\left(95-c\right)+8c=828$$

title: Substitution
text: Plug c into the original relationship between the passes to find g.

title: Calculation
text: The answer is 34 general and 61 youth.
